Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2014 02:26PM harmontm wrote: I thought I would check in with everyone.  I have been following the boards here, and my appointment with the surgical oncologist is on Monday.  It has been tough waiting, but I am finally almost there.  I am still having the same symptoms, but a week ago, I noticed a swollen lymph node under my arm which is the same side as the breast that is causing all the problems.  I have still only had bloody discharge from the nipple once, and it was spontaneous, but now the nipple burns.  The breast still itches, but only on the top half. It is driving me crazy, and can be embarrassing at times when I am in public and I have to discreetly try to get enough friction with my shirt to relieve it until I can get to a private location.  I am hoping for some answers on Monday, or at least a plan to get some answers since I have never had any problems with my breasts in the past.  This is new for me, and I am so thankful there is this great site with wonderfully supportive women to listen, advise, and support each other.

Posts.Content: harmontm wrote: Hi Everyone, I am 34 with 2 kids.  About 8 weeks ago, I noticed a dime size red spot on my left breast on the top right side.  It is slightly raised and bright red.  There is no center hole, pus, etc...  Anyway, I thought it was a bug bite and ignored it.  2 weeks later, that breast grew a cup size, so I made an obgyn appt.  Then, a week later, I had a small amount of bloody discharge from my nipple onto my nightgown.  I saw my primary doctor for a vitamin d check and showed her, and she had me go in for a mammo and an ultrasound that day.  It was Birads 2 but they referred me to a surgical oncologist because of their concerns.   I scheduled with the doctor I wanted to see, but the appt is on June 30th.  I saw a different guy, and he said it was probably a bug bite and to put cortisone on it, then do another ultrasound in 6 weeks to make sure.  The whole top half of my breast is itching now, and the spot is now heart shaped.  I have taken antibiotics, tried cortisone, and fungal cream.  Nothing has helped.  Should I see the other doctor on June 30th as a second opinion?   Thanks! Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2014 02:59PM harmontm wrote: Thank you Betty14.  I have kept the appointment.  I am still seeing no change as far as the red spot except that it is now nickel size.  It is still bright red, and the itching is driving me crazy.  I try to hold pressure on my breast for a little bit to calm the itching so I won't tear my skin.  The skin on the left side around the areola is thickened as well, so I am a bit concerned.  I just wish I could get in to see her sooner so I don't have to worry about it.  I don't have a strong family history of breast cancer, so that is good  My mom had ovarian cancer.  Hopefully it is just an infection, but I would have thought the antibiotics I took would have helped that.  UUGGGHH!  The body can be so frustrating.  I am not one to go to the doctor unless I have to.  My husband practically has to drag me, but this has concerned me enough to actually go.  Anyway, I appreciate your time and response.
